instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00292: What is 820-00292? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PLT_RESET_L: What is PLT_RESET_L? PLT_RESET_L is platform reset, this signal keeps the system from POSTing. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .
definitions.PPVCC_S0_CPU: What is PPVCC_S0_CPU? The "PPVCC_S0_CPU" power rail is responsible for supplying power to the CPU when the MacBook is fully on, or in the S0 state. This rail is one of the main voltages that the CPU requires for operation. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00292</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> iMac 27-inch 2015 only 2 LED lights , Fan spins No chime.
threads.message:
HI all,

This board has only 2 led light up no chime. Tried different rams no luck. 
All the power rails are present . cpu 12v FET gets 12 v. How ever <TRANSISTOR>Q8450</TRANSISTOR> pin 4 <SIGNAL>FET_EN_P12V_S0_R</SIGNAL> is 24v. I dont kno is this correct volatge .

I have 2 logic boards same model same issue.

Any help greatly appriciate .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00292</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> iMac 27-inch 2015 only 2 LED lights , Fan spins No chime.
threads.message:
"I dont kno is this correct volatge"
It is...

VCORE present?
Check <SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> too.

Did you test USB activity?

Try known good BIOS, just in case.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00292</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> iMac 27-inch 2015 only 2 LED lights , Fan spins No chime.
threads.message:
Hi 2 info thank you for your reply. <SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> is 3.3V, <SIGNAL>PPVCC_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> is 1.2V. <SIGNAL>PPVCCGT_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> is 0v.

NO USB Activity. I'll try with good known bios, could this be bad CPU? I have 2 boards one with i5, and i7  6700k . I swap the CPU's still the same.
